54B41302583140F38319CFEB6057E858.description:
use relative pronouns (e.g.,
who, whom, which, that),
• use relative adverbs (e.g.,
where, when, why)
• use prepositional phrases
• use subordinating
conjunctions
• use the progressive and
perfect verb tenses
• produce and expand
simple, compound, and
complex sentences

4C20FF070DE0449D898F1AA9CE1436F2.description:
use relative pronouns (e.g.,
who, whom, which, that),
• use relative adverbs (e.g.,
where, when, why),
• use prepositional phrases
• use subordinating
conjunctions
• produce and expand
simple, compound, and a
few complex sentences

C51E8D2CBA984C74BCEF3337FF9E479C.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences),
• use some relative
pronouns (e.g., who,
whom,
which, that),
• use some relative
adverbs (e.g., where,
when, why),
• use some
prepositional phrases
• produce and expand
simple and compound
sentences

B55187B0B5864B159F0374DDB66459DB.description:
with support (including visual
aids and modeled sentences),
• recognize and use some
frequently occurring
nouns, pronouns, verbs,
prepositions, adjectives,
adverbs, and conjunctions
• produce simple sentences
in response to prompts

2BBC958A1A284452B0C70C939D4FB081.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids),
• recognize and use a small
number of frequently
occurring nouns, noun
phrases, and verbs
• understand and respond to
simple questions

B21B5DAFF8B84C04BDBC9617DB7E1866.description:
An English Language
Learner can make accurate use of
standard English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate speech
and writing.

CE3D6B7FA2F7418BB9C2F09485E05E6A.description:
introduce an
informational topic
• develop the topic with
facts and details
• recount a more detailed
sequence of events, with a
beginning, middle, and end
• use a variety of linking
words and phrases to
connect ideas, information,
or events
• provide a concluding
statement or section

A523CF60ABF54BC286DF0257CFA6B8EA.description:
introduce an
informational topic
• develop the topic with
facts and details
• recount a more detailed
sequence of events, with a
beginning, middle, and end
• use transitional words and
phrases to connect events,
ideas, and opinions (e.g.,
after a while, for example,
in order to, as a result)
• provide a conclusion
with increasingly independent
control

501B4EDDEA18475B9E15B5DA478D0F9B.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences),
• introduce an
informational topic
• present one or two facts
about the topic
• recount a short
sequence of events in
order
• use an increasing range
of temporal and other
linking words (e.g., next,
because, and, also)
• provide a concluding
statement
with developing control

F08ADB20B29A4DC98EB51752278C0C07.description:
with support (including visual
aids and modeled sentences),
• communicate simple
information about a topic
• recount a simple sequence
of events in order
• use frequently occurring
linking words (e.g.,
and, then)
with emerging control

69B8E3FEE38A4A76A7ED0FF74D4681B3.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids),
and using non-verbal
communication,
• communicate simple
information about an event
or topic
• use a narrow range of
vocabulary and syntactically
simple sentences
with limited control

ED7702D3D454429C96ABBFBD2A989ED5.description:
An English Language
Learner can create clear and coherent
grade-appropriate speech
and text.

CB3940F9240C4FA78BF6F5C174A7763B.description:
using context, reference
materials, and knowledge of
English morphology,
• determine the meaning
of general academic and
content-specific words and
phrases
• determine the meaning of
figurative language (e.g.,
metaphors, similes, adages,
and proverbs)
in texts about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

88A6D08CC3AF403EB59A5B155BF27838.description:
using context, reference
materials, and an increasing
knowledge of English
morphology,
• determine the meaning
of general academic and
content-specific words,
phrases
• determine the meaning of a
growing number of
 idiomatic expressions
in texts about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events

0367B52B309D4D79B83C179C06F21137.description:
using context, visual aids,
reference materials, and a
developing knowledge of
English morphology,
• determine the meaning
of frequently occurring
words and phrases
• determine the meanings
of some idiomatic
expressions
in texts about familiar topics,
experiences, or events

510CC0A7671B44FD843B37058EAF5745.description:
using context, some visual
aids, reference materials, and
knowledge of morphology in his
or her native language,
• determine the meaning of
some frequently occurring
words, phrases,
and expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar topics,
experiences,
or events

2DE974FF88DA4FA383009000523EF8E9.description:
relying heavily on context,
visual aids, and knowledge of
morphology in his or her native
language,
• recognize the meaning of
a few frequently occurring
words, phrases, and
formulaic expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar topics,
experiences,
or events.

6DAF2067BDDE4F63B455CB1706A3E931.description:
An English Language
Learner can determine the meaning of
words and phrases in oral
presentations and literary and
informational text

70345B1CDF924510995B8472DB8DC9E1.description:
adapt language choices and
style according to purpose,
task, and audience
• use a wide variety of
general academic and
content-specific words
and phrases
in speech and writing.

F9FF3AB8F52B4786B1593D96E1F9C741.description:
with increasing ease,
• adapt language choices
and style (includes register)
according to purpose, task,
and audience
• use a wider range of
general academic and
content-specific words
and phrases
in speech and writing.

497CD8B363D1419DBF7D0A7E79277E97.description:
with developing control,
• adapt language choices
according to purpose,
task, and audience
• use an increasing
number of general
academic and content-specific words, phrases,
and expressions
in conversation,
discussions, and short
written text.

8A29CD261A9F44E7A324F9543C3F907A.description:
with emerging control,
• adapt language choices
to different social and
academic contents
• use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read to

C500F8422DFF409892B3DBF77ACCE363.description:
recognize the meaning
of some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read to

B7AAF0321A4043929E036AD57517373D.description:
An English Language
Learner can adapt language choices
to purpose, task, and
audience when speaking
and writing.

F1DED724E2AF492690343924B4641AE9.description:
explain how an author or
speaker uses reasons and
evidence to support or fail
to support particular points
• (at grade 5) identify which
reasons and evidence
support which points

0C3A41916F34422BBB6CEAABD1E28168.description:
describe how reasons
support the specific points
an author or speaker
makes or fails to make

5DE7836F0EA9460990427C295CDB7ADE.description:
tell how one or two
reasons support the
specific points an author
or speaker makes or
fails to make

9A0BEB2D869543D6A2BDE28BAE181026.description:
identify a reason an author
or speaker gives to support
a main point
• agree or disagree with the
author or speaker.

4702ADD340D44AF29902D5C9A9413998.description:
identify a point an author or
speaker makes

F906E44190A84DE0A9A0A55263CD4DC7.description:
An English Language
Learner can analyze and critique the
arguments of others orally
and in writing.

2E9149DFFDCF42A3BF1BBA452377A0EB.description:
recall information
from experience
• gather information from print
and digital sources
• summarize key ideas and
information in detailed and
orderly notes, with graphics
as appropriate.
• provide a list of sources.

E50F86BFB9CA4FC8B3C8B5656FF607CD.description:
recall information
from experience
• gather information from print
and digital sources to answer
a question
• record information in
organized notes, with charts,
tables, or other graphics,
as appropriate.
• provide a list of sources

1F3EEC7E75184C99B1F68E5C7D79ED2C.description:
recall information
from experience
• gather information from
print and digital sources to
answer a question
• identify key information in
orderly notes.

40201EA839D846978B30E623D4AFAD45.description:
recall information
from experience
• gather information from
provided sources.
• record some information.

9F2410FFD0CD4D33B45C1C5B7869227E.description:
recall information
from experience
• gather information from a
few provided sources
• label some key information.

A440040558364C87897EE64252A8D831.description:
An English Language
Learner can conduct research and evaluate
and communicate findings
to answer questions or solve
problems.

74B57C05C79249D38D3825CBC07571AD.description:
construct a claim about a
variety of topics
• introduce the topic
• provide logically ordered
reasons or facts to
support the claim
• provide a
concluding statement.

FCEC2A914B104890915EDAADCD92DE42.description:
construct a claim about a
variety of topics
• introduce the topic
• provide several reasons or
facts to support the claim
• provide a
concluding statement.

C585A27AD85D4794807638B8FB42D547.description:
construct a claim about
familiar topics
• introduce the topic
• provide a few reasons or
facts to support
the claim.

AD87E86562C045B09F4DB83472A27577.description:
construct a simple claim
about a familiar topic
• give a reason to
support the claim

B90600D60DB94E2990A22ADD1193EBAF.description:
express an opinion about a
familiar topic

BC828E6ADA494346BA70B05EB8EA239E.description:
An English Language
Learner can construct grade-appropriate
oral and
written claims and support
them with reasoning
and evidence.

B6A5BFCDAD1E4A9782131E17EA1E8E5E.description:
including details and
examples to develop a topic,
• deliver oral presentations
• compose written narrative
or informational texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, and experiences

8A6610B134D841F980D78B253B67F228.description:
including some details,
• deliver short oral
presentations
• compose written narratives
or informational texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, and experiences.

9A0CDC3839CF4F15A5D2E0084731A010.description:
including a few details,
• deliver short
oral presentations
• compose written
narratives or
informational texts
about familiar texts, topics,
and experiences.

47432D18E00D42C7A096D7F81DF4D627.description:
deliver short
oral presentations
• compose written texts
about familiar texts, topics,
and experiences

659DF59AA0E947C69AD7BABF10D05866.description:
communicate
simple information about
familiar texts, topics,
events, or objects in
the environment.

23C124F2CBB04E4E98E627AA88341AD7.description:
An English Language
Learner can speak and write about
grade-appropriate complex
literary and informational
texts and topics.

9BD25E1A3C814EA2AC03B1DDE2F53B7A.description:
participate in extended
conversations and
discussions
• participate in extended
written exchanges
• build on the ideas of others
• express his or her own
ideas clearly
• pose and respond to
 relevant questions
• add relevant and detailed
information using evidence
• summarize the key
ideas expressed
about a variety of topics
and texts.

614250FB03F84B189BE248EA705AEDB1.description:
participate in conversations
and discussions
• participate in
written exchanges
• build on the ideas
of others
• express his or her
own ideas
• ask and answer relevant
questions
• add relevant information
and evidence
about a variety of topics
and texts

73B4CC6758EA4BF49829FBFE23C70BEC.description:
participate in short
conversations and
discussions
• participate in short
written exchanges
• respond to others’
comments
• add some comments of
his or her own
• ask and answer
questions
about familiar topics
and texts

321E6154513B483F91B8B641F6AD0DE0.description:
participate in short
conversations
• participate in short written
exchanges
• actively listen
to others
• respond to simple
questions and
wh- questions
about familiar topics and texts

D50726E11B434AB29B14DC3957748A4C.description:
participate in
short conversations
• participate in short
written exchanges
• actively listen to others
• respond to simple
questions and some
 wh- questions
about familiar topics.

9A81833B79184931B755A8512AC792AC.description:
An English Language
Learner can participate in grade appropriate oral and
written exchanges of
information, ideas, and
analyses, responding to
peer, audience, or reader
comments and questions.

7A60FE760BC948E4B837C5A5EDDACA0F.description:
use a wide range of
strategies to:
• determine two or more
main ideas or themes
• explain how key details
support the main ideas or
themes
• summarize a text
from read-alouds,
written texts, and oral
presentations.

F178A0A4227440CB931734286A94272C.description:
use an increasing range of
strategies to:
• determine the main idea or
theme, and
• explain how some key
details support the main
idea or theme
• summarize part of a text
from read-alouds,
written texts, and oral
presentations.

7D5F4715B6B44B6FB71A3953F030CBD2.description:
use a developing set of
strategies to:
• determine the main idea
or theme, and
• retell a few key details
• retell familiar stories
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

AB95B532044C49BD96521D57A8E7725E.description:
use an emerging set of
strategies to:
• identify the main topic
• retell a few key details
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

18EED9A2D66C4FAD80771806A6C07032.description:
use a very limited set of
strategies to:
• identify a few key words
and phrases from
read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

9A7BD83DAE724CCEB1D5AB5059601156.description:
An English Language
Learner can construct meaning from
oral presentations and
literary and informational
text through grade appropriate listening,
reading, and viewing.
